content.description: This course focuses on a range of meta-normative issues including, but not restricted to, objectivity of normative claims, nature of normative knowledge, & relationship between normative reasoning & normative facts. The focus is the manuscript of Conor McHugh & Jonathan Way's Getting Things Right: Reasons, Value, and Fittingness, to be published by Oxford University Press. We work through the manuscript of McHugh & Way's book; McHugh & Way visit some sessions to answer questions; there is a series of informal discussions between participants; we have 4 outside speakers give talks on related topics (speakers tba).
content.name: Practical Normativity: Reasons, Value, and Fittingness
